p: Infectious diseases continue to place a considerable burden on global human health and will likely continue to do so for the foreseeable future. Despite successes such as the eradication of smallpox and reductions in the prevalence of falciparum malaria, there are also many examples of pathogens with emerging or intensifying transmission or exhibiting geographic spread. Many interacting factors are involved in this dynamic, including changes in temperature and rainfall, increasing levels of urbanization, changes in land use, and an increase in commuting and travel distances [ 1].
